author: Staff Reporter
text:
Chennai City Police rescued a six-year-old boy kidnapped for ransom within a few hours after the incident was reported on Sunday.

A senior police officer said Shanmugavel, an electrical contractor, received an anonymous call around noon that his son Velkandasamy was kidnapped. The kidnappers demanded a ransom of Rs. 5 lakh. The family, living in Padi Kuppam Road, was shocked and contacted the city police. A special crime team was immediately formed. The investigating policemen advised police to maintain contact with the kidnappers regularly. Based on the phone calls, the police were able to trace the number to a spot in Tambaram Sanatorium.

The special team travelled by a suburban train to Tambaram Sanatorium and they approached the suspects under the guise of handing over the money. When one of the suspects brought the boy for the exchange, he was nabbed and the boy rescued. Investigations established that Shankar (24) of Rajapalayam, had planned the kidnap along with Suresh (24), a former employee of Shanmughavel. Suresh is absconding, police sources said.
title: Police rescue boy within a few hours of kidnap
